column5: BOSTON/NEW YORK  Sept 22 Bank of America Corp  shareholders voted to allow Chief Executive Brian Moynihan to remain as chairman  handing a victory to a CEO who has been slowly turning the bank around since the financial crisis.

column4: UPDATE 1-Launch provider picks Orbital ATK rocket motors in Aerojet setback
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas  Sept 22 United Launch Alliance  a joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp  and Boeing Co  on Tuesday said it had selected Orbital ATK  as the sole provider of solid rocket motors for its Atlas V and Vulcan launch vehicles from 2019.

column4: Pentagon  Lockheed eye agreement on next F-35 contracts this fall
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas The U.S. Defense Department on Tuesday said it hopes to reach agreement this fall with Lockheed Martin Corp on contracts for the next two batches of F-35 fighter jets in a deal that could be worth $15 billion.

column4: UPDATE 1-Pentagon  Lockheed eye agreement on next F-35 contracts this fall
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas  Sept 22 The U.S. Defense Department on Tuesday said it hopes to reach agreement this fall with Lockheed Martin Corp on contracts for the next two batches of F-35 fighter jets in a deal that could be worth $15 billion.

column4: Lockheed-Boeing launch venture opts for Orbital ATK solid rockets
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas  Sept 22 United Launch Alliance  a joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp  and Boeing Co  on Tuesday said it had selected Orbital ATK  as the sole provider of solid rocket motors for its Atlas V and Vulcan launch vehicles.

column4: Pentagon  Lockheed eye agreement on next F-35 contracts this fall
column5: FORT WORTH  Texas  Sept 22 The U.S. Defense Department on Tuesday said it hopes to reach agreement this fall with Lockheed Martin Corp on contracts for the next two batches of F-35 fighter jets in a deal that could be worth $15 billion.

column4: BRIEF-Aker Philadelphia sells its interest in product tanker joint venture to Marathon Petroleum
column5: * Aker Philadelphia Shipyard Inc entered into definitive agreements with a subsidiary of Marathon Petroleum Corporation for buy-out of APSI's interest in its joint venture with Crowley Maritime Corporation

column4: Metlife boosts share buyback program to $1 billion
column5: Metlife Inc   the largest U.S. life insurer  said it has increased its share repurchase program to $1 billion.

column4: Metlife boosts share buyback program to $1 bln
column5: Sept 22 Metlife Inc  the largest U.S. life insurer  said it has increased its share repurchase program to $1 billion.

column4: Ex-Morgan Stanley adviser pleads guilty in connection with data breach
column5: NEW YORK A former Morgan Stanley  financial adviser who was fired in connection with a major breach of client information pleaded guilty on Monday to taking confidential data for hundreds of thousands of customer accounts from a bank computer without permission.

column4: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Sept 22 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2010 GMT on Tuesday:

column4: Blackstone talks to buy NCR in peril: sources
column5: Private equity firm Blackstone Group LP  has so far not been able to reach a deal to acquire NCR Corp  or find a partner to help fund a bid worth up to $10 billion  including debt  people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

column4: Blackstone talks to buy NCR in peril -sources
column5: Sept 22 Private equity firm Blackstone Group LP  has so far not been able to reach a deal to acquire NCR Corp or find a partner to help fund a bid worth up to $10 billion  including debt  people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Newmont's Indonesian copper export permit will not be renewed - govt officials
column5: JAKARTA  Sept 22 Newmont Mining Corp's  Indonesian copper export permit  which expired on Tuesday  will not be renewed as the U.S. miner has failed to meet government stipulations for developing a domestic smelter  government officials said.

column4: Newmont not interested in Barrick's U.S. assets  eyes Australia
column5: DENVER  Sept 22 Newmont Mining Corp is not interested in buying the U.S. assets Barrick Gold  has put up for sale  but would be keen on Barrick's 50 percent stake in an Australian mine at the right price  Newmont Chief Executive Gary Goldberg said on Tuesday.

column4: Drug maker Novo Nordisk to build $78 million plant in Iran
column5: COPENHAGEN Danish drug maker Novo Nordisk will invest 70 million euros ($78 million) to build a manufacturing plant in Iran  joining a small group of European companies to announce concrete deals there since the Islamic Republic reached a nuclear deal in July.

column4: UPDATE 3-Drug maker Novo Nordisk to build $78 mln plant in Iran
column5: COPENHAGEN  Sept 22 Danish drug maker Novo Nordisk will invest 70 million euros ($78 million) to build a manufacturing plant in Iran  joining a small group of European companies to announce concrete deals there since the Islamic Republic reached a nuclear deal in July.

column4: Mylan countersues Perrigo over 'misstatements' about tender offer
column5: NEW YORK Mylan NV countersued Perrigo Co on Tuesday over "serious misstatements" it made as part of its defense against an unsolicited $27 billion tender offer by the generic and over-the-counter drugmaker.

column4: UPDATE 1-Mylan countersues Perrigo over 'misstatements' about tender offer
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 22 Mylan NV countersued Perrigo Co on Tuesday over "serious misstatements" it made as part of its defense against an unsolicited $27 billion tender offer by the generic and over-the-counter drugmaker.

column4: Mylan countersues Perrigo over 'misstatements' about tender offer
column5: NEW YORK  Sept 22 Mylan NV countersued Perrigo Company Plc on Tuesday over "serious misstatements" it made related to the generic and over-the-counter drugmaker's unsolicited $27 billion tender offer.

column4: Petrobras says it was not prepared for 'brusque' drop in oil prices
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA  and the Brazilian oil industry  were not prepared for "such a brusque fall" in petroleum prices  the company's manager of exploration and production Cristina Pinho said at an event in Rio de Janeiro on Tuesday.

column4: Petrobras says it was not prepared for 'brusque' drop in oil prices
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Sept 22 Brazil's state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA  and the Brazilian oil industry  were not prepared for "such a brusque fall" in petroleum prices  the company's manager of exploration and production Cristina Pinho said at an event in Rio de Janeiro on Tuesday.

column4: Petrobras says in final talks with Mitsui over gas unit stake
column5: BRASILIA Brazil's Petróleo Brasileiro SA said on Tuesday it is in the last stages of talks to sell a minority stake in a natural gas distribution holding company to Japan's Mitsui & Co Ltd  in its drive to dispose of over $13 billion worth of non-essential assets by the end-2017.

column4: UPDATE 1-Petrobras says in final talks with Mitsui over gas unit stake
column5: BRASILIA  Sept 22 Brazil's Petróleo Brasileiro SA said on Tuesday it is in the last stages of talks to sell a minority stake in a natural gas distribution holding company to Japan's Mitsui & Co Ltd  in its drive to dispose of over $13 billion worth of non-essential assets by the end-2017.

column4: Petrobras  Mitsui in final talks over gas unit stake sale
column5: BRASILIA  Sept 22 Brazil's state-controlled oil producer Petroleo Brasileiro SA said on Tuesday it is in the last stages of negotiations with a Mitsui & Co Ltd  Brazilian unit over the purchase of a minority stake in a natural gas holding company.

column4: BRIEF-Potash Corp CEO says K+S deal may happen if shareholders like offer
column5: * Potash Corp CEO says if K+S shareholders like offer  it might eventually happen; declines comment on strategy

column4: UPDATE 1-Aluminum market to return to balance but more cuts needed -Rio Tinto
column5: VANCOUVER  Sept 22 Global aluminum demand will rise by 24 million tonnes to reach 78 million tonnes a year by 2025  a Rio Tinto executive said at an industry conference on Tuesday  but oversupply will continue to force further capacity closures.

column4: Aluminum demand to rise to 78 million tonnes by 2025 -Rio Tinto
column5: VANCOUVER  Sept 22 Global aluminum demand will rise by 24 million tonnes to 78 million tonnes annually by 2025  a Rio Tinto executive said at an industry conference on Tuesday  though market fundamentals will continue to force further capacity closures.

column4: CORRECTED-BRIEF-Frontline terminates tanker contract  to receive $1.3 mln
column5: * Says agreed with Ship Finance International Limited to terminate the long term charter for the 1995 built Suezmax tanker Front Splendour  which has surveys due end this year

column4: Southern Copper says it sees opposition to Peru project easing
column5: AREQUIPA  Peru  Sept 22 Southern Copper Corp  said on Tuesday that opposition to its Tia Maria project in southern Peru is easing thanks to a door-to-door campaign in communities where activists derailed the project with protests earlier this year.

column4: State Street  a top B of A shareholder  says supported Moynihan in vote
column5: BOSTON An executive for State Street Global Advisors said it voted to let Bank of America Chief Executive Brian Moynihan keep his additional title of chairman  votes that helped him retain the role at the bank's shareholder meeting held earlier on Tuesday.

column4: State Street  a top B of A shareholder  says supported Moynihan in vote

column4: Canada pension fund votes to separate Bank of America roles
column5: The Canada Pension Plan Investment Board said on Tuesday it has voted to strip Bank of America Corp Chief Executive Officer Brian Moynihan of his chairman's title  the biggest shareholder so far to declare its intentions in a closely watched corporate governance contest.

column4: UPDATE 2-Cellnex looking at possible Inwit bid  F2i also interested-sources
column5: LONDON/MILAN  Sept 22 Spain's Cellnex  is working on a possible offer for telecom tower group Inwit   controlled by Telecom Italia  several sources close to the matter said.

column4: Italy - Factors to watch on September 22
column5: The following factors could affect Italian markets on Tuesday.

column4: BRIEF-Telecom Italia Media receives notification from savings shareholders against the merger in Telecom Italia
column5: * Said on Monday it received notification of a petition submitted by the common representative of the savings shareholders to obtain the urgent suspension of implementation  or at least the inhibition of the implementation  of the Telecom Italia Media shareholder resolution taken on April 30 2015

column4: U.S. regulators allege Total rigged natgas market for three years
column5: U.S. federal energy regulators extended their years-long effort to crack down on a contested form of market manipulation on Tuesday  alleging that French firm Total SA and two of its traders rigged southwestern natural gas prices for years.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. regulators allege Total rigged natgas market for 3 years
column5: Sept 22 U.S. federal energy regulators extended their years-long effort to crack down on a contested form of market manipulation on Tuesday  alleging that French firm Total SA and two of its traders rigged southwestern natural gas prices for years.

column4: U.S. regulators allege Total manipulated natgas market for 3 years
column5: U.S. federal energy regulators on Tuesday alleged traders at the U.S. arm of French energy company Total SA manipulated the natural gas market in the southwestern United States between June 2009 and June 2012.

column4: No advice-of-counsel defense in Wells Fargo lawsuit
column5: A former Wells Fargo & Co vice president cannot raise an advice-of-counsel defense against federal fraud claims if doing so would force his onetime employer to waive its attorney-client privilege unwillingly  a federal judge ruled on Tuesday.

column4: Oakland lawsuit accuses Wells Fargo of mortgage discrimination
column5: NEW YORK The City of Oakland  California has sued Wells Fargo & Co  accusing the largest U.S. mortgage lender of steering minorities into high-cost mortgage loans that allegedly led to foreclosures  abandoned properties and neighborhood blight.
